title: How it works
text: vignette documents raiden Addin locates R objects, determines structure, provides UI interface editing roxygen2 tags.

title: How it works
How it works
text: Let’s load objects global environment: gather_objects() function find objects global environment. gather_classes() identify objects global environment, also return class: case object multiple classes, gather_classes() collapses single character (separated comma (,)):
code: my_list <- list('mtcars' = datasets::mtcars,                 'attitude' = datasets::attitude,                'titanic' = datasets::Titanic) mtcars <- datasets::mtcars my_time <- Sys.time() R6_class_generator <- R6Class() R6_object <- R6_class_generator$new() gather_objects(type = "all") #> [1] "R6_class_generator" "R6_object"          "mtcars"             #> [4] "my_time"            "my_list" gather_classes() #> R6_class_generator          R6_object             mtcars            my_time  #> "R6ClassGenerator"               "R6"       "data.frame"  "POSIXct, POSIXt"  #>            my_list  #>             "list"

title: raiden
text: raiden package contains RStudio Addin documenting R objects–primarily functions, datasets (tibbles data.frames), methods (like R6). Resources developing raiden come RStudio Addins Designing Gadget UI articles. raiden designed called user object global environment ’d like document roxygen2 tags.

title: raiden
text: Creating objects document: run raiden::raidenApp() view Addin (beta):  Users can select: Object name class type enter: Object title populates appropriate roxygen2 template.
code: library(R6) my_list <- list('mtcars' = datasets::mtcars,                 'attitude' = datasets::attitude,                 'titanic' = datasets::Titanic) mtcars <- datasets::mtcars R6_class_generator <- R6Class() R6_object <- R6_class_generator$new()

title: Authors and Citation
Authors and Citation
text: Frigaard M (2023). raiden: roxygen2 addin documentation R. R package version 0.1.0, https://mjfrigaard.github.io/raiden/.
